snippet: After 16 years of litigation, the city reached a settlement with 16 strip clubs that does away with a number of rules, angering religious leaders and advocates for sex-trafficking victims.
abstract: Houston ends 16-year legal fight with strip clubs, reaching settlement with 16 of city's biggest clubs that eases several restrictions; deal angers religious leaders and advocates for sex-trafficking victims; agreement requires club owners to contribute $1 million annually to Police Dept unit fighting human trafficking; controversy has potential to hurt Democratic Mayor Annise D Parker.
lead_paragraph: After 16 years of litigation, the city reached a settlement with 16 strip clubs that does away with a number of rules, angering religious leaders and advocates for sex-trafficking victims.

headline.main: Houston and Its Strip Clubs Call a Truce
headline.print_headline: Strip Clubs And Their City Call a Truce
